utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES

We support the decision of the British people to realize full self- government and we will see how that goes. It's very complicated negotiation and not an easy negotiation. That's for sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That was the president earlier today reaffirming the United States' commitment to a strong trade relationship with post-Brexit England. Joining us now with reaction he is the Brexit leader, Nigel Farage. How are you, my friend? Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: FARAGE

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: FARAGE

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If we did the obstruction Hillary did, if we compromise sources and methods the way she did we would be in jail. Similarly, if we like the FISA court judges there's so much to unravel here. I know you are working hard on this every night. Let me ask you this question. We're here in London. Against all the advice of everybody that's here with me, I went out in the middle of the crazy protesters and we'll show --

utterances.speaker: DOBBS
utterances.utterance: Good for you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- it later tonight. Well, I'm just not going to back down, that's not how I roll. And that's not how you roll either. But the point is, Lou, they don't know what they hate. They have no clue and they don't know and that was the one consistent thing that I saw today which we will show the audience in a few minute.

utterances.speaker: DOBBS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think that's terrific. And those haters by the way, who were supposed -- you know, the national left-wing media of America has been styled as purely anti-Trump when we know that it is anti-capitalism, it's anarchists, it is -- my gosh, you know, they're still trying to produce a program for climate change and the list goes on but being styled by the left wing media, particularly in this country, as anti-Trump. The silly thing is that --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DOBBS
utterances.utterance: -- there are a lot of people who are anti-Trump around the world but they can't quite figure out why. Here's a guy who's got the entire global economy revving up. And if it weren't for this giant engine of the American economy, which he has ginned up to 4% likely, 4% GDP growth which all, you know, Obama of course said that's impossible is going to drive the global economy. It's a remarkable --

utterances.speaker: HANNITYL
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: DOBBS
utterances.utterance: -- the ignorance of those folks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. We'll show all that coming up. Lou Dobbs, thank you. When we come back, Trump hating FBI lawyer Lisa Page met with lawmakers. Catherine Herridge have reports.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: As we continue reporting from London, before we get to me going to the heart in the middle of the protests here in London when we have other news back home. Earlier today, Lisa Page she met with congressional lawmakers behind closed doors. Catherine Herridge, she is live from Washington. She's the very latest in some interesting developments. Catherine.

utterances.speaker: CATHERINE HERRIDGE, FOX BUSINESS CHIEF INTELLIGENCE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Well, thanks Sean and good evening. Former FBI Lawyer Lisa Page spent four hours on Capitol Hill and is expected back on Monday for the second half of a closed door deposition which could go into a classified setting. Heading in, Fox News asked Page whether she saw agent Peter Strozk testimony yesterday but their anti-Trump text messages whether her legal team coordinated the testimony with his lawyers and if she had any regrets. Page was romantically involved with Strozk did not respond but a senior committee Republican said she appears to be cooperating.

utterances.speaker: REP. MARK MEADOWS, R-NORTH CAROLINA
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to characterize her testimony because I think that would be not in the spirit of where we're trying to do with transcribed interviews. I will say that there is new information that we've been able to gain today. And that new information is credible.

utterances.speaker: HERRIDGE
utterances.utterance: Well, also today the justice department released the 29-Page indictment from the Russia special council alleging a direct link between the 2016 election interference and President Vladimir Putin's government. Between the 2016 campaign the defendants all members of Russian intelligence known as the GRU are accused of hacking Democrats' e-mails then releasing them and sometimes posing as U.S. citizens.

utterances.speaker: ROD ROSENSTEIN, UNITED STATES DEPUTY ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: The conspirators had created fictitious online personas including D.C. leaks and Guccifer 2.0. The defendants falsely claimed the D.C. leaks was a group of American hackers and the Guccifer 2.0 was a lone Romanian hacker.

utterances.speaker: HERRIDGE
utterances.utterance: In a statement, a White House spokesperson emphasized there is no allegation that any Americans knew they were corresponding with Russians, no allegation any American citizen committed a crime and certainly no allegation that the conspiracy changed the vote count. Sean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Catherine Herridge in Washington tonight. Here with reaction, Fox News contributor and investigative reporter Sara Carter and the author of we're only a little over week away, "The Russia Hoax, The Illicit Scheme to Clear Hillary Clinton and Frame Donald Trump." Fox News legal analyst Gregg Jarrett. All right. Let's go to your reporting on Lisa Page today which I think is obviously very, very important. But they only had a short time but there is one big development, especially Rod Rosenstein's name involved again. Yet again.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes. Absolutely, Sean. So they've asked a number of questions and there've been significant developments in that. But one of the things that we do know is that the January 4th letter that the House Intelligence Committee received from Rod Rosenstein, they agreed to allow them to interview eight witnesses, eight key witnesses. Two of them Peter Strozk, Lisa Page.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This is in January.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: This was in January. When they questioned Lisa Page and asked her why didn't she respond to the House Intelligence Committee's request? Why didn't -- she said the DOJ never contacted her. Rod Rosenstein never contacted her.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He's the same Rod Rosenstein that begged before the Nunes memo, begged Paul Ryan don't release this up until the final hours.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Yes. He is the same and it's even more interesting because this week, this week, Nancy Pelosi, Chuck Schumer, Mark Warner, all sent a letter. All sent a letter to Dan Coats asking him not to release basically reprimanding him for releasing information to the house intelligence committee, their own committee. So they don't even want the information.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Before he just that, there's something there. Just like Rod Rosenstein signing the fourth FISA warrant. They don't want to release especially 19 pages if my memories be well.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: That's right. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me go to Gregg Jarrett. Gregg, your reaction to this. Obviously, and with so much other stuff happening here today. Including the indictment of 19 people which Devin Nunes warned us about in 2014. This was under Obama's watch.

utterances.speaker: GREGG JARRETT, FOX NEWS LEGAL ANALYST
utterances.utterance: He did.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And we still don't know who hacked into Hillary's e-mail server and what methods and the sources were compromised there.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: You know it's not really the bombshell that the media seems to be proclaiming. And the American public if they are watching CNN or MSNBC, they are not getting the truth. They are being deliberately misled. I watched them today.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Fake news.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Dana Bash on CNN twice said that, you know, it's now imminent that Americans will be indicted over this. Meaning the Trump campaign. You have Adam Schiff who is--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It doesn't mean people might not but there's nothing happened here.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Andrea Mitchell is over on MSNBC saying there is now proof of a solid connection between Trump and the Russians. And Adam Schiff was actually musing today about the arrest of Donald Trump and then said I'm only half jesting about it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: So you know, if you really want the truth don't watch those networks because they are lying to American people about really happened today.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, actually, the American people already figured that out. Thank God. And they really don't. So that's some good news. But what about what Sara is saying here, that this is really important. Why would they not want specific information going to their own committees when it is their constitutional authority and duty to perform oversight? And where are the 19 pages to the final application, FISA warrant application that Rod Rosenstein signed?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Look, if the Department of Justice and the FBI were capable of lying to judges, concealing evidence, and hiding facts to obtain the warrant, they are certainly hiding other documents including, you know, the 19 that you refer to. So, I wouldn't put past to anything past the FBI and the Department of Justice when it comes to unscrupulous and probably illegal behavior.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And then that goes to the heart of what Gregg has said and what you have said and what I have said. That the president has the authority to force them to release all of this information.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: And the president should absolutely use that authority. The American people and the president and this administration deserve better than what they are getting. They deserve to know the truth. Let's get those 19 pages out, let's get them public not--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And let's get out what Chuck Schumer doesn't want out. What they are asking Dan Coats not to release.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. They have no reason to reprimand Dan Coats other than the fact that they are trying to hide something. And that's what FBI--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Whatever it is has got to be profound.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: It is.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: For them to write the letter to me is profound. Right?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Well, it's profound because they want to continue this disinformation campaign. They want to push this through to November.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: To the election.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: I say you know what? Let's not give them that opportunity. Let's just get the truth out for the American people. That's the most important.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. And thank you both. Only days away from Gregg's book by the way. Amazon.com and Hannity.com. Well, this is going to be a big book. An important book. I've read it. Thank you both. When we come back from London, left wing protesters right here angry at Donald Trump for daring to ask them to pay their fair share. Actually, they have no idea why they are angry at Donald Trump. They are just mad. And it was one big party. And I went down in the middle of it. And then we'll also get reaction from Dan Hoffman and Sebastian Gorka as we continue from London. Wait until you see this video coming up next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Earlier today against the advice of everybody here with me in London, well, we hit the streets. And we were asking all these protesters to tell us exactly, specifically what they don't like about President Trump. Well, you can't make this up. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why are you here today?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm here to protest.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What specifically don't you like about Trump?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I don't like his policies.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What policies?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: All of them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Tell Trump to go home. He is not welcome here. We don't want him in the U.K.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We hope that he takes this seriously.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Because he won't. He just ignore it. He said it hasn't happened. La, la, la.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This seems like a party. It doesn't seem too serious.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Everybody is here for a good time to spread a message of love.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Don't you love America?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We are not going to engage with you anymore.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Got it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You are very welcome to be here. Thank you, Hanna. I saw some people giving you trouble. There's no need for that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I think America is divided like Britain. I think part of America is deeply, deeply ashamed. And I think part of America has been hoodwinked.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you think that the NATO alliance that the United States of America is fair if they pay 70 percent of the bill? What are you protesting? Are you here to just -- you're just here to have a party. Be honest.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I can't believe this, man!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'm here because of all the hate that Trump exudes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Hate?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I wasn't going to come out initially because Trump is a (muted).

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why are you here?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: To protest against the Trump administration.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And what about them?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'm OK not being interviewed.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's a nightmare. He must be stopped.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: America, wake up. Vote him out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's been hot this summer for a reason. You know what I mean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is it Donald Trump's fault it's hot?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No. But I think he is promoting -- he is promoting climate change.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Donald is not welcome. Free Melania.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I detest Trump. Because of his policies, because of racism, and homophobia, misogyny and so he is just two-faced (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We respect human rights in this country. We would like him to see that the way that he acts and the way he speaks we profoundly, profoundly reject it. In a polite way.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The lies that he has told. Not to mention the human rights abuses that he's committed in his own country we don't think he has a place over here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: A lot of British people are more intelligent than the Americans are when it comes to voting.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'm angry even though I don't look angry. I am quite angry because I think -- I think that he represents everything that is toxic about western culture and western history. And I'm furious.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. They didn't really have good reasons but it was kind of a good party. A couple -- I was shocked how many people knew me. Here with reaction, the author of the book, "Why We Fight" Fox News national security strategist Dr. Sebastian Gorka. Retired CIA senior intelligence officer and Fox News contributor, Daniel Hoffman. Nobody wanted me to go down. Well we had one little minor, a little minor incident but we didn't get it on tape which drives me nuts. But it wasn't that bad. I was shocked how many people knew me but I was also -- they can't answer, because I come up and should we pay 70 percent? Why are you here protesting? He is a bad person. It reminds -- every time America shows strength on the world stage, European socialists liberals hate it. If it was Obama apologizing or dumping $150 billion on the mullahs, they would love it.

utterances.speaker: DANIEL HOFFMAN, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Very reminiscent to me of 1983 when the Europeans came out and protested against President Reagan for the Persian II missile deployment. And it's a great contrast.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: To protect Europe.

utterances.speaker: HOFFMAN
utterances.utterance: Right. And President Reagan was proven right years later. We all agreed it was the right thing to do. Worse those protests could not happen in places like Russia and China but that's the first point. And the second one we know the Russians have used their social networking and the media sites to try to amplify protest and hurt our president. I just wonder whether they might have done that in this case as well. I think that's something for our intelligence community to check on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. Dr. Gorka, your first reaction, we talked off air. You told me that you think I'm nuts for even doing it. But what's your reaction to this?

utterances.speaker: SEBASTIAN GORKA, FOX NEWS NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGIST
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: They don't have a point or no universal point or nothing specific. It's getting hot in world. Is that Trump's fault? No. OK. Why you're here?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sean, I would have told you not to do it but I'm glad you did. That was really very, very amusing and very telling. At least we now know that Donald Trump is responsible for global warming. I mean, look, these people, I would like to see at least this many Brits go out and demonstrate against terrorism. Go out and demonstrate against the grooming and the rape gangs that are being prosecuted. How about going out and demonstrating against female genital mutilation or the bombing of the Ariana Grande concert in Manchester. These are, look, we now have proof, Sean, snowflakes are everywhere. These are not the people who voted for Brexit. This is the chattering classes and they have nothing to tell you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, the reality is that but for the United States of America and our commitment to Europe and NATO, I mean, I just -- they don't survive. I mean, that is the stupidity. One of the I think best things the president did this week was tell Angela Merkel stop giving, stop creating dependency on Putin and a hostile regime. Stop. And we've got more natural resources and we could put more Americans to work with career jobs tomorrow and export all the energies they would ever need in all of Western Europe.

utterances.speaker: HOFFMAN
utterances.utterance: There is a bit of irony about all of this. Because Europe is under a greater threat from Russia today than at any time since the collapse of the Soviet Union. And yes, the United States takes the lead in countering and deterring Russia.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Seventy plus cents of every dollar, Daniel, we pay for NATO. Seven hundred billion a year and Germany doesn't pay their fair share.

utterances.speaker: HOFFMAN
utterances.utterance: I mean, even beyond the financial aspects of this. It's really our moral leadership our intelligence leadership, the strategic leadership of the United States. People aren't always grateful for that. But again, on the eve of the president's summit with Vladimir Putin, I find it awfully ironic.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, the president said today everything is on the table with Vladimir Putin. I mean, just like the lead up to the Kim Jong-un summit in Singapore, this is a bad idea. The president shouldn't do this. Dr. Gorka, I think it's good for the world if the president, we saw how direct he was with NATO. He is going to be the same way. He can't be any different. That's who he is. It will be an honest, forthright frank discussion just like it was with little rocket man and fire and fury.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: You know the president. I know the president. And people always ask what's he really like? And the viewers need to understand. He is exactly the same behind closed doors as he is in front of 50,000 people in an arena in Florida. He is a straight shooter. And you know when he closes that door and it's just him and the interpreters he is going to say look, what you did in the Ukraine is wrong. That cannot stand. Stop messing around in Syria. We've already killed 200 of your mercenaries and stop threatening NATO. He is going to be a straight shooter. But look, you know, Rod Rosenstein and everybody else wants to talk about Russian collusion. It's a fantasy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: As we all know. Dr. Gorka, we wish you were here with us. Good to see you, my friend.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Me too.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And welcome to London.

utterances.speaker: HOFFMAN
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And we'll see you in Helsinki on Monday. When we come back, Brexit leader, Nigel Farage as we continue live in London. Monday, Helsinki, Finland we hope you'll join us.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: Once the Brexit process is concluded and perhaps the U.K. has left the E.U., I don't know what they are going to do but whatever you do is OK with me. That's your decision. Whatever you are going to do is OK with us. Just make sure we can trade together. That's all that matters. The United States looks forward to finalizing a great bilateral trade agreement with the United Kingdom. This is an incredible opportunity for our two countries and we will seize it fully. We support the decision of the British people to realize full self- government and we will see how that goes. It's very complicated negotiation and not an easy negotiation. That's for sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That was the president earlier today reaffirming the United States' commitment to a strong trade relationship with post-Brexit England. Joining us now with reaction he is the Brexit leader, Nigel Farage. How are you, my friend? Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: NIGEL FARAGE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Good to see you here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why didn't you come to the protest with me?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Because I'm hated even more than Donald Trump. And in fact, I went into a building--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: -- at Westminster earlier, and they found I was there. They gathered outside.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Protesters?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I had to go out the fire exit at the back. But I've got you a souvenir.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You did?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think--

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: I think it's very important that we have that. "Not to Torture."

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Could you sign it?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely!

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Because you got to remember that Trump is guilty for climate change, torture. I mean--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's right. Every hill of the world.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: -- nothing in the world.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way you know, 14 states have record low unemployment, record low unemployment for Hispanic Americans, African-Americans, women in workplace, and we have more jobs available in America than we have people that take them on the unemployment.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: There is no rationale for this. You know, every one of those people out there are the same people that go with the anti-Brexit marches. You know, it's just the same crowd.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So the president in The Sun obviously took Theresa May to task.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I told her how to do it and she didn't do it right. She didn't.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: The truth of it is Trump believes in Brexit. The whole administration believes in Brexit. Why? They believe in nation state. Why? Because they understand that the European Union is the epicenter of the globalist project. That's what Hillary was for, that's what Donald was against, that's what the election was about.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. And you won by a big margin here.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: We did win by a big margin but what we've now a couple of years on is an establishment fighting back very hard. A very weak prime minister who doesn't really believe in what she is doing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: She says the right thing and never does it.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: No. She says the right thing and does the opposite. It's quite extraordinary. I think they wind her up at the back in the morning, you know.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ouch!

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: She robotically claim, robotically says we are taking back control of our laws, borders and money. It sounds great. And then you see what she does is different. But I always think this, from the early days of the administration I remember talking to people around the president. And they were saying to me how excited they were about a free trade deal with the U.K. Why? Because it showed the world--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: In jeopardy.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: It showed the world that America is not protectionist bu he wants fair trade.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Free and fair trade.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely! We promise to America that we would facilitate that once Brexit happened. But the agreement May made last week makes that virtually impossible. So, I, you know.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The prime minister seems to be hanging by a thread from my observation.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Boris Johnson, big speech coming up on Monday. Does he have a chance? Because he wasn't pro-Trump that I remember.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: The idea that they are good friends is nonsense. You know, I mean--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I love your honesty.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Boris -- I mean, Boris didn't even want Trump to come to London. Times has changed. And there are certain politicians who can be a little bit malleable with these things.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: A little bit?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Just the way it is. The truth is--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why don't you run for prime minister?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: The truth is, well, the truth is Boris did join the Brexit party. He may have came late but he did and he was important. If we had Boris as a leader we would be in a far better place than we are with Theresa May. Middle England is in uproar.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you support him?

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Well, I--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why not you? Because you were the Brexit leader.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Well, I -- OK. Yes. What I am, I kind of step back a bit from the frontline politics in Britain. But if they drop the ball and if the conservative party cannot sort this out, I'll be back and the next time no more Mr. Nice guy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. I'll take that as a yes. OK. Last question. We, listen we love our friends in Great Britain. We are tied forever. I only have about 25 seconds.

utterances.speaker: FARAGE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We pay 70 cents of every dollar for NATO. Why won't Germany step up? And why are they making Russia rich again with energy?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
